headline: Disney to lay off 28,000 employees as coronavirus slams its theme park business
summary: Prolonged closures of Disney's California-based theme parks and limited attendance at its open parks has forced the company to lay off 28,000 employees across its parks, experiences and consumer products segment.

headline: Indoor farming start-up with Martha Stewart on its board joins the SPAC craze to go public
summary: "We're on a warpath here to change agriculture for the good, get chemical pesticides out, get labor practices we can all be proud of," AppHarvest CEO Jonathan Webb told CNBC.

headline: Goldman Sachs CEO shuffles consumer banking, wealth management leaders
summary: Solomon's moves are the latest changes he has made to Goldman's structure nearly two years into his tenure atop the bank.

headline: Ad exec Martin Sorrell says Facebook and Google shouldn't be broken up, boycotts pointless
summary: Famed advertising executive Martin Sorrell told CNBC that Google and Facebook have been exercising more responsibility and shouldn't be broken up by regulators.

headline: Amazon downplayed rising injury rates at its warehouses, investigation finds
summary: Amazon's injury rates were higher at warehouses with heavy automation, despite the company's claims that such technology would improve safety, Reveal found.

Senate Democrats are calling for Supreme Court nominee Amy Coney Barrett to pledge to recuse herself from future cases related to the 2020 election, after President Donald Trump said the court might decide the outcome and he expects her to break a tie.
headline: Democrats Pressure Trump Court Pick Barrett on Election Recusal

summary: As the number of deaths related to Covid-19 surpasses 1 million globally, it's clear that the pandemic will have continuing devastating effects on New York City's economy.
headline: New York City misses out on billions of tourism dollars as coronavirus keeps Broadway dark

summary: United left JFK airport in late 2015 in favor of Newark, where it dominates traffic.

headline: Nikola shares slide after second sexual abuse allegation raises questions about GM deal
summary: Nikola's shares fell after CNBC reported new sex abuse allegations against founder Trevor Milton and General Motors said that it was still in discussions over a $2 billion deal with the electric truck maker, which was expected to close Wednesday.

headline: Washington emergency responders first to use SpaceX's Starlink internet in the field: 'It's amazing'
summary: SpaceX's Starlink satellite internet network has been used in the field by Washington state emergency responders in recent weeks.
